newsitem.title: TAIWAN: PRESS DIGEST - Taiwan newspapers - October 30.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Taiwan newspapers - October 30.

text.p: These are the leading stories in the Taiwan press on Wednesday. Reuter has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
CHINA TIMES - Local official of northern Taipei county arrested for alleged involvement in gun smuggling case.
Former Poland president Walesa to vist Taiwan on Thursday for newspaper seminar.
UNITED DAILY NEWS - Cult leader Miao Tien acknowledges collecting more than T$1 billion from followers.
James Wood, chairman of Washington's de facto Taipei embassy, the American Institute in Taiwan, under investigation by U.S. State Department in campaign donation case.
COMMERCIAL TIMES - China will send representatives to attend Taiwan-Hong Kong economic seminar in Hong Kong.
Taiwan invites bids from private firms to build high-speed railway.
ECONOMIC DAILY NEWS - Communications ministry urges government to lift ban on foreign shipping companies, allowing them to sail between Taiwan and China.
Bad cheque ratio continues to fall in September, showing financial improvement in many companies.
